intro: Engellaria, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have evergreen leaves and produce small, bell-shaped flowers that are often white or pink. Engellaria species are adapted to acidic soils and are often found in woodland or heathland environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental foliage and winter interest.
